means: 不喜欢，厌恶( dislike的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He grumbled out his reasons for disliking the arrangement.
sentence.Network_cn: 他抱怨地说出了他对这种安排不高兴的原因.

sentence.Network_en: She often tried to provoke Darcy into disliking her guest.
sentence.Network_cn: 她常常挑拨达西使他厌恶她的客人.

sentence.Network_en: Disliking this chore and relieved that it would end soon, he continued fielding questions.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一边暗自庆幸这件讨厌的差事快完了, 一边继续回答问题.

PerfectNetExp.abs: she often tried to provoke Darcy into disliking her guest .她常常挑拨达西使他厌恶她的客人。

list.abs: Wherever I go , nowhere I like ; I dislike everywhere ., 无论我到哪里 , 没有哪里为我喜欢 , 我讨厌每一个地方.
am sorry to disappoint you , but I dislike wearing such dress ., 对不起 , 让你失望 , 我不喜欢穿这种服装.
It is not that I dislike you ., 并非是我讨厌你.
are there any animals which you dislike ., 你讨厌什么动物.
七年级上册英语复习提纲 ... let sb do sth 让某人做某事 dislike doing sth 不喜欢做某事 keep doing sth 保持一直做某事.

entry.def: If you dislike someone or something, you consider them to be unpleasant and do not like them.

example.ex: We don't serve liver often because so many people dislike it...
example.tran: 我们不常做肝这道菜，因为很多人吃不惯。

example.ex: David began to dislike all his television heroes who smoked.
example.tran: 戴维开始讨厌所有他曾喜欢的吸烟的电视偶像了。

entry.def: Dislike is the feeling that you do not like someone or something.

example.ex: He made no attempt to conceal his dislike of me...
example.tran: 他毫不掩饰对我的厌恶。

example.ex: Years of dislike boiled over and blows were exchanged.
example.tran: 多年的厌恶之情终于爆发，双方拳脚相加。

entry.def: Your dislikes are the things that you do not like.

example.ex: Consider what your likes and dislikes are about your job...
example.tran: 想想工作中哪些部分是自己喜欢的，哪些是不喜欢的。

example.ex: Strong irrational dislikes of other people can easily be picked up from others.
example.tran: 对他人无端的厌恶之情别人可以轻易察觉到。

entry.def: If you take a dislike to someone or something, you decide that you do not like them.

example.ex: I took a violent dislike to him...
He may suddenly take a dislike to foods that he's previously enjoyed.
example.tran: 对以前爱吃的食物，他兴许突然就没了胃口。

auth_sentence.content: Someone at the back admits to disliking the new "broccoli tree" logo.
auth_sentence.res_content: Someone at the back admits to disliking the new "broccoli tree" logo.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Someone at the back admits to disliking the new "broccoli tree" logo.

auth_sentence.content: I grew bored and frustrated at not being challenged, and ended up disliking math.
auth_sentence.res_content: I grew bored and frustrated at not being challenged, and ended up disliking math.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I grew bored and frustrated at not being challenged, and ended up disliking math.

auth_sentence.content: Rihanna tells Esquire magazine that disliking Brown "was taking up too much of my time" and that she has moved on from that.
auth_sentence.res_content: Rihanna tells Esquire magazine that disliking Brown "was taking up too much of my time" and that she has moved on from that.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rihanna tells Esquire magazine that disliking Brown "was taking up too much of my time" and that she has moved on from that.
